newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kohl says German payments to EU are too high.
newsitem.headline: Kohl says German payments to EU are too high.

text.p: Chancellor Helmut Kohl said in an interview released on Sunday that Germany's payments to the European Union were too high and should be reduced.

"The current payment level from Germany is too high, that's undisputed. And we must work to bring down this sum," Kohl said, according to a transcript of the interview with ZDF television recorded at his Austrian holiday home.

Asked if he would be able to push through a reduction in payments with Germany's EU partners, Kohl said: "We must try, I'm not alone. But I've been able to push through many things. I hope very much that we move in this direction."
Kohl said Brussels must recognise the efforts of all EU states to make savings in their own budget.
"I'm also not of the opinion that the Brussels apparatus can stay as it is now, in its dimensions," he added. "That's nothing new. My colleagues know my opinion."
